label: 三井高平
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: (Sōchiku, 1653-1737) [His] 1722 testament...enumerate[s] business procedures to be followed and the types of transactions to be avoided.  The [document] emphasize[s] copperation and harmony among the nine Mitsui branch shops, and ... caution[s] repeatedly against extravagance and forgetting one's place as a merchatn.  Sōchiku's views on merchant imprudence also appear in a work called Chōnin kōken roku (Some observations on merchants) which he completed about 1727 (p. 766). [宗竺、町人考見録]
